description: The Chilean Ministry of Health determines that, as of June 26, 2020, each Regional Ministerial Secretariat of Education may individually lift the in-person suspension of classes in all kindergartens and educational establishments in the country. For this, the Ministry of Health will inform in advance the sanitary feasibility of this measure to the Ministry of Education and will deliver the regulations, instructions, and protocols the establishments have to follow. Likewise, the corresponding Regional Ministerial Secretariat of Health will supervise the compliance with these regulations. Only those establishments that can follow the regulations will be allowed to open.

description: The Chilean Ministry of Health determines that, as of June 26, 2020, each Regional Ministerial Secretariat of Education may individually lift the in-person suspension of classes in all kindergartens and educational establishments in the country. For this, the Ministry of Health will inform in advance the sanitary feasibility of this measure to the Ministry of Education and will deliver the regulations, instructions, and protocols the establishments have to follow. Likewise, the corresponding Regional Ministerial Secretariat of Health will supervise the compliance with these regulations. Only those establishments that can follow the regulations will be allowed to open. UPDATE: The permission granted to each Regional Ministerial Secretariat of Education on June 26, 2020, to individually lifting the in-person suspension of classes in all kindergartens and educational establishments in the country end on July 28, 2020, with the start of the "Step by Step" (Plan Paso a Paso) plan.

description: Chile declares Health Alert throughout the territory of the Republic to face the threat to public health produced by the worldwide spread of the COVID-19. Through a decree, extraordinary powers are granted to the under-secretariats of Public Health and Assistance Networks under the Ministry of Health to face possible infections. The Health Alert was originally set to start from February 8 but the starting date was changed to February 5. It will be in force until June 30.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: Chile declares as areas affected by the catastrophe generated by the spread of Covid-19, and for a period of twelve months, the 346 communes corresponding to the 16 regions of the country, that is, Tarapacá, Antofagasta, Atacama, Coquimbo, Valparaíso, del Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins, Maule, Biobío, La Araucanía, Los Lagos, Aysén del General Carlos Ibáñez del Campo, Magallanes and the Chilean Antarctic, Santiago Metropolitan, Los Ríos, Arica and Parinacota, and Ñuble.

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: Chile declares a Health Alert throughout the territory of the Republic to face the threat to public health produced by the worldwide spread of the COVID-19. description:
The Chilean government takes new preventive measures at the airport from January 31. Passengers who report having been in a country with active outbreaks must answer a detailed survey of risk factors.
Passengers who present symptoms that could be compatible with those of the Coronavirus, such as fever above 38 degrees and cough, will be referred to an isolated area that is already defined.
Travelers arriving and leaving the country will continue to be provided with educational material and information indicating what to do in the event of an illness before, during, or after an international trip.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: The Chilean Ministry of Health has announced on Thursday, February 6, that it would implement increased airport screenings for those who have traveled to an area affected by the novel coronavirus. The authority did not specify whether this applies exclusively to those with travels to China, nor within what time frame. The official website states that, in the event that a passenger arrives with a health situation that could be compatible with Coronavirus, with symptoms such as fever above 38 degrees (Celsius, 100 F) and cough, this person will be referred to an isolated area that is already defined. The affected airports include those in Antofagasta, Valparaiso, the Santiago metropolitan region, Biobio, Araucania, and Los Lagos.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: Chile, the Regional Secretary of the Ministry of Health of the Metropolitan region reinforces preventive measures against suspected cases of COVID-19 at the Arturo Merino Benítez International Airport from February 17. All passengers arriving from China must complete a survey to find out if they have been in this Asian country in the last 14 days. They will also be subjected to body temperature control to determine if it could be considered a suspicious case.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: The government of Chile announced that from February 28, all travelers who enter the country, and whose final destination is Chile, must present an affidavit regarding their state of health. This declaration must be completed at the aircraft, ship, or land border port, as appropriate. Ships and aircraft must distribute the form "Affidavit of health status" among their passengers. The end date has not been specified.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

International travellers will be required to submit an affidavit of countries that they have visited in the 30 days before arrival. Those who have been to affected countries will receive additional screening.

description: Chile declared external border rules after March 10, 2020. description: Chile has extended the closure of all land, sea, and air borders until September 12, to further curb the spread of the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the country. The closure does not apply to freight operations and associated personnel.

description:
Chile, The Regional Ministerial Secretariat of the Los Lagos Region establishes on April 6 a set of requirements for inland cargo in and out of Chiloe Island due to the COVID-19 outbreak. Main points: 

- The transportation of inland cargo and necessary supplies for the maintenance of the island's supply chain, the provision of critical services, and sanitary services must go through the sanitary customs of the Chacao Channel, located in the Avellanal area of Pargua town in the commune of Calbuco. 

- The driver of the vehicle must travel with up to two companions. 

-The driver and the companion will undergo a health check at the sanitary customs. 

- The vehicle and its cargo must be sanitized at the health customs.

description:
Romania, March 22, 2020:
The Romanian National Institute of Public Health / National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases (CNSCBT) provides a list of countries/regions affected by quarantine measures. These include: The Chinese Hubei Region; Italy; the South Korean city of Daegu and county of Cheongdo; Iran. All travellers from these places are quarantined for 14 days upon arrival in spaces specially designed for this purpose (red zone). Additionally, those from countries with over 500 confirmed cases of Covid-19 infections (yellow zone) need to enter self-isolation for 14 days upon arrival. The current yellow zone countries are: Australia; Austria; Belgium; Brazil; Canada; Czech Republic; Chile; all other places in South Korea and China; Denmark; Ecuador; Switzerland; Finland; France; Germany; Greece; Ireland; Israel; Japan; Malaysia; UK; Norway; Netherlands; Pakistan; Poland; Portugal; Spain; USA; Sweden; Turkey. The ending of this policy depends on decreasing infection transmission rates. UPDATE: From March 23, Saudi-Arabia, Indonesia and Iceland are added to the list of yellow zone countries.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Chile puts first school in quarantine and updates the protocol of quarantine for educational establishments. In case a student has a direct relative with covid 19, she/he has to complete 14 day quarantine. If a student is infected with covid 19, his whole class will be quarantined. If two or more students or a employee of the school is covid-19 positive, the whole establishment will be quarantined for 14 days. This takes effect on March 13.

description: The Ministry of Economy, Development, and Tourism of Chile authorizes on April 23 the extension of deadlines for holding general meetings of members to cooperatives. Cooperatives that lost more than 50% of their assets during 2020 due to the health crisis caused by the outbreak of COVID-19 will have 90 calendar days after becoming aware of the situation to hold their general meeting of members. Cooperatives who had achieved a capital loss equal to or greater than 50% will have 30 calendar days to hold their meeting. If cooperatives become aware of their financial situation during the prohibition to hold public events with more than 50 people (March 30, 2020), they will have 90 or 30 calendar days respectively to hold their meetings counted from the day the prohibition was lifted.

description: The Ministry of Science, Technology, Knowledge, and Innovation (El Ministerio de Ciencia, Tecnología) of Chile broadens the scope of support and advice from the Special or Exception Technical Committee (Comité Técnico Especial o de Excepción) to any process of allocation of resources that the National Director of the Research and Development Agency (Agencia de Investigación y Desarrollo) deems necessary to carry out during the period of health emergency due to the global outbreak of Covid-19. This policy will take into force from March 30 for an indefinite period.
